, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><i>Above: The field created by above pattern can only be appreciated by a Kirlean camera.</i></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When I say conscious ,\nyou must understand that the elephant is the only animal who passes a mirror\ntest fully like human beings. &nbsp;That is\nwhy we have them in our temples, where you get to elevate your consciousness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-0t3Tr4IZFoE/UXS7evtC-AI/AAAAAAAAhvw/85Sg9_FooY8/s1600/iii.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"267\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-0t3Tr4IZFoE/UXS7evtC-AI/AAAAAAAAhvw/85Sg9_FooY8/s400/iii.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The festival is\nconducted in the vast premises of Vadakkumnathan Shiva Temple in Thrissur.&nbsp; The 6000 year old temple stands majestically\non an elevated hillock right in the heart of the city. Thrissur pooram, is\ncelebrated here every year in the month of Medam (mid-April to mid-May) when\nthe moon rises with the Pooram star.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://img.youtube.com/vi/fFUA-52KinU/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://youtube.googleapis.com/v/fFUA-52KinU&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://youtube.googleapis.com/v/fFUA-52KinU&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lord Parasurama , the\nsixth avatar of Lord Vishnu , the warrior patron saint of Kerala, reclaimed the\nland of Kerala from the sea. &nbsp;He came to\nKerala with a band of Namboodiri Brahmins after the river Saraswati dried up.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He asked Shiva and his\nfamily to descend from Mount Kailasa to bless the inhabitants of this new land.\n&nbsp;Shiva indeed came riding the bull\nRishabha ( Vimana ) , accompanied by Parvati, Ganesha, Subrahmanya and his\nparashadas and landed under a banyan tree ( Sree Moolasthanam ). &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-EFMQY3wI9w4/UXTUzqzKRII/AAAAAAAAhwQ/Y8egQU_VJwQ/s1600/220px-Sreemoola_sthanam.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-EFMQY3wI9w4/UXTUzqzKRII/AAAAAAAAhwQ/Y8egQU_VJwQ/s400/220px-Sreemoola_sthanam.jpg\" width=\"300\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shiva stopped for a\nwhile and then disappeared . &nbsp;Parashurama\nsaw a bright and radiant Shiva lingam at the foot of this huge banyan tree. From\nthat tree, &nbsp;Parasurama invoked Shiva to\nthe location of the present sanctum of Vadakkunnathan and installed the Shiva\nlingam. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-QKh7Mnc4nZk/UXTVVjKuHLI/AAAAAAAAhwg/5I85DB0y23c/s1600/vsv.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-QKh7Mnc4nZk/UXTVVjKuHLI/AAAAAAAAhwg/5I85DB0y23c/s400/vsv.jpg\" width=\"356\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the ancient days the place\nwas known as \u201cTiru Shiva Perur' or the town with the name of Lord Shiva. &nbsp;Lord Shiva here is popularly known as\nVadakkunnathan of the Lord from the North.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vadakkunnathan\nTemple has this Shiva Lingam inside , but you cant see it, as it is submerged\nunder 6000 years of ghee offerings. This is the only temple in India where\nLingam is not visible . Parasurama &nbsp;anointed the lingam first with ghee. Despite\nthis the ghee does NOT become rancid or invaded by insects, and it does not\nmelt even during summer. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-hSPuozlvLhQ/UXXw2niXxUI/AAAAAAAAhzM/TMOq1safZpI/s1600/625558_191431631004025_676945408_n.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"240\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-hSPuozlvLhQ/UXXw2niXxUI/AAAAAAAAhzM/TMOq1safZpI/s320/625558_191431631004025_676945408_n.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A devotee\nlooking into the inner sanctum can now see only a 16-foot-high &nbsp;mound of ghee embellished with thirteen\ncascading crescents of gold and three serpent hoods at top. When the ghee\nstarts sliding down like a mini avalanche, this amount is given as prasad to\nthe devotees.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let me put a 100 year\nold picture of &nbsp;Vadakkunnathan Temple ,\nprinted by the British Hoe and Coat the 'Premier Press'.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-N5xD7gzghcQ/UXTVAIubL9I/AAAAAAAAhwY/bIBUOAd0uRk/s1600/250px-55Trichur_Temple_Main_Entrance.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"318\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-N5xD7gzghcQ/UXTVAIubL9I/AAAAAAAAhwY/bIBUOAd0uRk/s400/250px-55Trichur_Temple_Main_Entrance.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shivaguru and Aryamba,\nthe parents &nbsp;of Adi Shankaracharya worshipped\nShiva at this temple to beget a son in 2000 BC. &nbsp;They walked 53 kms to Thrissur from Kalady. They\nchanted bhajans in praise of Shiva for 41 days. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Legend has it that Lord Shiva appeared to both\nhusband and wife in their dreams and offered them a choice. They could have\neither a mediocre son who would live a long life or an extraordinary son who\nwould die early. &nbsp;Both Shivaguru and\nAryamba chose the second option. &nbsp;&nbsp;It was no wonder that Adi Shankaracharya\nmastered the voluminous Vedas by the age of six, which normally takes a whole\nlifetime.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1jfG8law0GQ/UXTVnkJzPoI/AAAAAAAAhwo/0OaTOVOMSQc/s1600/downloadcaq.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"255\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1jfG8law0GQ/UXTVnkJzPoI/AAAAAAAAhwo/0OaTOVOMSQc/s400/downloadcaq.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In honour of Shiva, they named\nthe son Sankara. &nbsp;&nbsp;Adi Shankaracharya &nbsp;attained videha mukti (\"freedom from\nembodiment\") in Vadakkunnathan temple as per Kerala legend.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://img.youtube.com/vi/HkUNZ6nbP2k/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://youtube.googleapis.com/v/HkUNZ6nbP2k&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://youtube.googleapis.com/v/HkUNZ6nbP2k&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nArattupuzha Pooram was the biggest temple festival of\nKerala. &nbsp;The participants of Thrissur\nPooram were regular participants of this Pooram, which has a history of 4000 years . &nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nAbout 210 years ago the King of\nCochin shifted the venue to the present site, for political reasons.<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nHardly anybody knows this real reason.<o:p></o:p><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-xc63vahhO9A/UXX0qjUb1cI/AAAAAAAAh04/hlApkW8qkr0/s1600/imagesCA8ZY30Z.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-xc63vahhO9A/UXX0qjUb1cI/AAAAAAAAh04/hlApkW8qkr0/s320/imagesCA8ZY30Z.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nThrissur was part of the kingdom\nof the king of Calicut ( my home town ). Then came the Portuguese Christian\ninvader in 1498, who landed in Calicut for spice trade. &nbsp;These white men had NIL honour.&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nThey thought\nthey can impress the king with coloured glass pieces and beads, the way they\nhad WOWED the black savages in Africa.<br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-OzQtl9G8qmU/UXXw-Twjg6I/AAAAAAAAhzY/_KxQ6NdrufY/s1600/00201_263932.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"202\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-OzQtl9G8qmU/UXXw-Twjg6I/AAAAAAAAhzY/_KxQ6NdrufY/s320/00201_263932.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nLittle did they know that when their ancestors were running around\nnaked, living in caves , clubbing animals for food and doing grunt grunt for\nlanguage, the people of Kerala were wearing fine cotton and silk , wearing\ndiamonds and pearls, eating cooked food from a menu and writing poetry.<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nThey wanted to undercut the Arabs\nwho were middlemen in the spice trade, and the honourable king was not ready to back stab people whom Kerala has been trading with for millenniums. .&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nThe Portuguese\nused to steal the pepper vines at night.&nbsp;\nWhen the king was told about this he laughed loudly and cried \u201c They can\nsteal our pepper plants and even our soil , &nbsp;but can they steal our weather ?\u201d<o:p></o:p><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-bRqf8AlnXo0/UXXxHf2QfTI/AAAAAAAAhzg/ZykLV6t1S6s/s1600/imagestrek.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-bRqf8AlnXo0/UXXxHf2QfTI/AAAAAAAAhzg/ZykLV6t1S6s/s1600/imagestrek.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">The Portuguese did NOT want to\npay custom duty for the trade and things went from bad to worse. They gave\nseveral local girls&nbsp;</span><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">venereal</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;disease by raping them. &nbsp;To escape retribution &nbsp;they kidnapped this king\u2019s close relatives and\nfled in their ships towards Cochin, &nbsp;as they knew the King of Cochin was the\nmortal enemy of the King of Calicut ( Zamorin ).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">Monsoon weather prevented the Calicut king from pursuing the Portuguese ships who has long range cannons. . Finally the Portuguese set\ncamp at Goa and they were kicked out for good in 1961. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nPunch into Google search <b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">PORTUGUESE\nINQUISITION IN GOA &nbsp;VADAKAYIL</span></b><o:p></o:p><br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-a_G95GxFtfc/UXX0435DdDI/AAAAAAAAh1A/1byEqBjwVx8/s1600/imagesCAJUW4YZ.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"201\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-a_G95GxFtfc/UXX0435DdDI/AAAAAAAAh1A/1byEqBjwVx8/s320/imagesCAJUW4YZ.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nIn 1761 when Hyder Ali , the\nfather of Tipu Sultan attacked the super rich kingdoms of Calicut . to\nsteal the gold from the temple vaults, the King of Calicut committed suicide,\nrather than be servile to this cruel man.&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nThe king of Cochin made a deal , accepted\nthe Mysore's superiority, and became a vassal for payment of heavy money. &nbsp;With this sweet deal the king of Cochin bargained\nover Thrissur and secured it. <o:p></o:p><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-XrJiWCqn44Q/UXX0G-kPzNI/AAAAAAAAh0w/9zaivlJAX5s/s1600/yufl.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-XrJiWCqn44Q/UXX0G-kPzNI/AAAAAAAAh0w/9zaivlJAX5s/s400/yufl.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nRama Varma Kunhjipilla Thampuran ,\npopularly known as Sakthan Thampuran shifted his capital from Cochin to\nThrissur. &nbsp;But the people of Thrissur both\nhigh and low castes , were still loyal to the Kings of Calicut , who were honourable kings.<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nHyder Ali\u2019s son Tipu Sultan again\ninvaded Calicut in 1788 , and Calicut was razed to the ground along with\nthousands of Hindu temples . &nbsp;&nbsp;Fires took more than a month to be put out. <o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nPunch into Google search <b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">TIPU\nSULTAN UNMASKED VADAKAYIL</span></b><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nThis is the man Salman Khurshid\nand the Italian waitress turned empress has been trying to establish as freedom\nfighter and secular.<o:p></o:p><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-wg6yha7knr0/UXXzyDxOszI/AAAAAAAAh0o/12pmJjrVE2s/s1600/xno.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-wg6yha7knr0/UXXzyDxOszI/AAAAAAAAh0o/12pmJjrVE2s/s400/xno.jpg\" width=\"266\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nTipu Sultan did NOT destroy the Vadukunnathan\nTemple at Thrissur as his Hindu astrologers advised him that it would bring him\nill luck. &nbsp;This trust in Hindusim was for his own selfish good.<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nKing Shaktan Thampuran ( ruled\nfrom 1769-1805) was merciless with all those who were loyal to the King of\nCalicut and this included the Namboodiri Brahmins who ran the temples. &nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nThe Cochin king had support both from the British who\nhad killed Tipu Sultan and the southern king of the state of Travancore. To\nstart the exodus the king wrested the temples of Thrissur from the Namboodiri\nBrahmins of Thrissur ( Yogiatiripppads ).<br />\n<br />\nThese Brahmins had been in charge of\nthe Thrissur temples since the days of Parashurama. &nbsp;Now these poor guys were totally uprooted, like snake charmers without snakes.<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>To get the moral support of the\nlow castes he started the Thrissur Pooram. &nbsp;This was almost like Nero having the games in\nRome, to get instant popularity , win the hearts of the vast majority low castes , and to consolidate his rule.. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nlast Yogiatirippad was banished from Trichur 1763 for being loyal at heart to the king of Calicut , Zamorin against Cochin. &nbsp;One by one the Namboodiris were ethnically cleansed and the numerous Namboodiri illams situated\nin Trichur gradually became extinct.</span><br />\n<br />\nIn the days of the Calicut King\u2019s\nrule, Arattupuzha Pooram was the biggest temple festival of Kerala. The current\nparticipants of Thrissur Pooram were regular participants of this Pooram. &nbsp;During one particular year of floods Shaktan Thampuran used this as an excuse\nto break from past tradition. He shifted the pooram to Vadakkunnathan Temple\nwhich is on higher ground. &nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nAnd since\nthen the pooram has been there. There still used to be competition from temples\nloyal to the King of Calicut and temples loyal to King of Cochin. &nbsp;This competition still exists, though all have\nforgotten the root cause. &nbsp;&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-OBKURk8yhhk/UXXzoApeAcI/AAAAAAAAh0g/DMMFR39BvN8/s1600/beach+(3).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-OBKURk8yhhk/UXXzoApeAcI/AAAAAAAAh0g/DMMFR39BvN8/s1600/beach+(3).jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nEven today no Hindu from Calicut would look\nbeyond Thrissur for brides and bride grooms for their children. &nbsp;For the Hindu king of Cochin had first\nmollycoddled the cruel Muslim invader and then the white Christian invader. <o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nToday the Kudamattam competition\nis between two groups the Western and the Eastern. &nbsp;The Western group consists of Thiruvambady,\nKanimangalam, Laloor, Ayyanthole, and Nethilakkavu temples. Paramekkavu,\nKaramukku, Chembukavu, Choorakottukavu and Panamukkamppilly come under eastern\ngroup.&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nNobody knows the past and well, let bygones be bygones. In the bargain\nhere is a festival which is for everybody.<o:p></o:p><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Cochin king may\nthink that he has done a great thing , and he must have gladdened the hearts of\nthe white Christian invader, whose only interests was to divide the Hindus. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hindu temples are NOT\nlike churches and mosques. &nbsp;There are\nproper puja procedures. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>Most of the\nKerala temples are now run by &nbsp;PRETENDER\nPUJARIS &nbsp;who draws a monthly salary from\na Dewaswom board run by soulless atheist communists, &nbsp;and manipulated by Christian and Muslim ruling\nministers whose loyalties lie in Vatican and Mecca. &nbsp;</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-dg9njkgY9RY/UXXkx8y2LNI/AAAAAAAAhw4/zh5Z9V_QWvE/s1600/e2qdf.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"244\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-dg9njkgY9RY/UXXkx8y2LNI/AAAAAAAAhw4/zh5Z9V_QWvE/s320/e2qdf.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is what has happened in most of the ancient\nKerala temples. &nbsp;Hindu temples are all\nabout raising your consciousness. &nbsp;Hindu\ntemples are NOT for carnivals like in Goa or Mardi Gras.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You cannot have a\nscavenger pujari from a clan , who has no spiritual traditions and who\ncannot utter a single mantra for nuts, the way BR Ambedkar wanted it , prodded\non by the British-- all in the name of human rights . &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Let human rights remain outside the inner sanctums of our ancient Hindu temples. You must be qualified like a neuro-surgeon in a brain surgery theatre.</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-5t10X-QHW4w/UXXlDzBJW9I/AAAAAAAAhxA/zgqd9NZjPHw/s1600/gadhi_ambedkar_20120820.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-5t10X-QHW4w/UXXlDzBJW9I/AAAAAAAAhxA/zgqd9NZjPHw/s400/gadhi_ambedkar_20120820.jpg\" width=\"198\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Today if my wife wants to do some special pujas for her\ndead ancestors, or my sons , &nbsp;she goes\nall the way outside Kerala to Mookambika temple in Kollur Karnataka. &nbsp;She being a Reiki grandmaster knows which\ntemple has what vibes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>POWER OF MANTRAS ON HUMAN CONSCIOUSNESS VADAKAYIL</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-BtiLI9kyBio/UXXs9bJU1JI/AAAAAAAAhxo/P2IIFKiZKXw/s1600/3513317496_90287bb96b_o.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"214\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-BtiLI9kyBio/UXXs9bJU1JI/AAAAAAAAhxo/P2IIFKiZKXw/s320/3513317496_90287bb96b_o.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nThe massive display of sound\nexplosives Vedikettu also started after Tipu Sultan was killed. &nbsp;This was never a visual display . This was\nmore of a crude terrific sound display, that we too have gunpowder, bombs &nbsp;and rockets. <br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-IjYWKNhjtPs/UXXsweTFqrI/AAAAAAAAhxg/xb_Ct21fujo/s1600/kkk.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-IjYWKNhjtPs/UXXsweTFqrI/AAAAAAAAhxg/xb_Ct21fujo/s400/kkk.jpg\" width=\"387\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nTipu Sultan\u2019s\nand his father Hyder Ali\u2019s army were no match for the Kerala Nair swordsmen in prowess\nwho carried swords like umbrellas. But the Mysore Muslim kings had rockets and long range cannons.<o:p></o:p><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-5VjGrtKCiGg/UXXzcny37vI/AAAAAAAAh0Y/XC0Npbx-72U/s1600/river.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"239\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-5VjGrtKCiGg/UXXzcny37vI/AAAAAAAAh0Y/XC0Npbx-72U/s320/river.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Back\nto Thrissur pooram. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thrissur\npooram is a festival unique in its pageantry and &nbsp;magnitude. The Pooram attracts a lot of\nelephant enthusiasts. &nbsp;With over 50\nelephants at the pooram site, and many more all over town, keeping them well\nfed and hydrated in the hot season is an uphill task. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-FWRuQ-xmUG8/UXXu8PDKKiI/AAAAAAAAhyg/WEap0bHXM-c/s1600/3518511315_cfde9c0669_o.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"233\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-FWRuQ-xmUG8/UXXu8PDKKiI/AAAAAAAAhyg/WEap0bHXM-c/s320/3518511315_cfde9c0669_o.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During the festival, over 100 caparisoned\nelephants will pass through the town and all of them have micro chips in them.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-96arY8tzgRs/UXXvRzAPS_I/AAAAAAAAhyw/slaLQCFhjCk/s1600/elephantbaby.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"213\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-96arY8tzgRs/UXXvRzAPS_I/AAAAAAAAhyw/slaLQCFhjCk/s320/elephantbaby.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In\nthe Pooram ground the people throng so close that if there is a rain shower ,\nno moisture will &nbsp;hit the ground.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It\nmust be noted that Vadukumnathan Temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva, remains a mute\nspectator during the festival , only involved in granting the premises and\nconvenience for the festival. &nbsp;No\noffering is received nor is any expenditure incurred by the temple in\nconnection with the Pooram. Not even a special puja is offered on the occasion.\n&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-jACoiva5_c4/UXXzRD1gf_I/AAAAAAAAh0Q/kGEPvJE_wq8/s1600/snakeboat.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"212\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-jACoiva5_c4/UXXzRD1gf_I/AAAAAAAAh0Q/kGEPvJE_wq8/s320/snakeboat.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\ncustom was developed by Shaktan Thamburan , as if all the gods and goddesses\nare doing pooram ( a meet) in front of Shiva, considered by Hindus as a supreme\ngod. &nbsp;&nbsp;Only Sastha\u2019s ( divine combination of shiva\nand Vishnu ) or Durga\u2019s are the participant of the pooram.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Here\nyou get to hear the electrifying Kerala traditional music (Chembada Melam,\nPandi Melam, and Panchavadyam) . &nbsp;This is\nNOT like a western symphony orchestra were all are nattily dressed and sit like\ndead fish. &nbsp;Here you can feel the thumping cymatic energy resonating every cell in your body. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-nbzKluw3Z3U/UXXvK4TTdcI/AAAAAAAAhyo/DW9N3xR6qqI/s1600/ggg.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"146\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-nbzKluw3Z3U/UXXvK4TTdcI/AAAAAAAAhyo/DW9N3xR6qqI/s320/ggg.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Panchavadyam\nhas about 250 expert artistes playing musical instruments like Thimila,\nMaddalam, Trumpet, Cymbal and Edakka . &nbsp;&nbsp;'Pandemelam', is for 200 artistes holding\nmastery of drum, trumpets, pipe and cymbals..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-TpYJlO_nzwg/UXXwf_q4TXI/AAAAAAAAhzE/aW1Q3p_bLug/s1600/7084835453_e678b88fcd_m.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"213\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-TpYJlO_nzwg/UXXwf_q4TXI/AAAAAAAAhzE/aW1Q3p_bLug/s320/7084835453_e678b88fcd_m.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Several\nprocessions with caparisoned elephants form various temples land up at the\nvenue. &nbsp;The most impressive processions\nare those from the Krishna Temple at Thiruvambadi and the Devi Temple at\nParamekkavu . &nbsp;The sprawling Thekkinkadi\nmaidan, en circling the Vadakumnathan temple, is the main venue of the\nfestival. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ivYhGd4mOWI/UXXwYDzKOMI/AAAAAAAAhy8/L9DcseFHgsw/s1600/005.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"224\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ivYhGd4mOWI/UXXwYDzKOMI/AAAAAAAAhy8/L9DcseFHgsw/s320/005.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\ndrummers , all in the zone, literally mesmerize the onlookers. &nbsp;You can feel the collective consciousness . &nbsp;&nbsp;'Elanjithara Melam' ( drum beats in front of\n\"Elanji\" tree or bulletwood tree ) is performed in which artistes\nplay drums, pipes and cymbals for hours on end as if in a trance. &nbsp;The entire display is divided into 3 kalams,\nbased on the speed of percussion. &nbsp;It\nneeds no mention that the 3rd is the fastest an d the most explosive in nature.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-l6FGTYND9Lg/UXXufybj6FI/AAAAAAAAhyY/s2cHaEm0fdE/s1600/037.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"300\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-l6FGTYND9Lg/UXXufybj6FI/AAAAAAAAhyY/s2cHaEm0fdE/s400/037.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Poorma\nstarts with the ceremonial flag hoisting (Kodiyettam) by various participating\ntemples. &nbsp;Ten temples take part in the\nfestival. &nbsp;But like I said before the main\nparticipants are the \u2018Bhagawathys\u2019 ( goddesses) from the Thiruvambadi and the\nParamekkavu temples. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-w-lMsa8I8GQ/UXXzA6UtHBI/AAAAAAAAh0I/AqPV8n8gkds/s1600/tiger.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-w-lMsa8I8GQ/UXXzA6UtHBI/AAAAAAAAh0I/AqPV8n8gkds/s1600/tiger.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These two temples had&nbsp; never been under the control of Namboodiris, &nbsp;are given pride of place.. &nbsp;Here lies the King\u2019s politics . &nbsp;Usually Kerala kings never interfere in temple\naffairs, and hence you can identify the British invader\u2019s role in this . <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-lMTpshf9GDc/UXXuVbnmm-I/AAAAAAAAhyM/kujTevWYDG0/s1600/220px-ThrissurPooram-Kuda.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"273\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-lMTpshf9GDc/UXXuVbnmm-I/AAAAAAAAhyM/kujTevWYDG0/s320/220px-ThrissurPooram-Kuda.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nmain Pooram starts on the sixth day after the flag hoisting. &nbsp;The spectacular show of 'Kudamattom' ( parasol\nexchange ) is the cynosure of all eyes . Parasols of myriad numbers, designs\nand colours are exchanged by the people atop the 30 elephants, of which 15 line\nup one side and the other 15 on the opposite side and it is a virtual\ncompetition between the two eyeballing sides. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-dWiNjzo8rPg/UXXt8ixAY5I/AAAAAAAAhx8/YFjtULlvwNk/s1600/hhh.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"226\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-dWiNjzo8rPg/UXXt8ixAY5I/AAAAAAAAhx8/YFjtULlvwNk/s320/hhh.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On\neach elephant are perched three men atop waving the \u2018aalavattom\u2019\n(peacock-feather fan), \u2018venchamaram (white gazelle-hair fan) and \u2018kuda\u2019\n(silver-sequinned parasols in all the imaginable hues). &nbsp;The tallest tusker in the middle carries the\ngolden \u2018thidambu\u2019 representing the deity.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ijcp1ImIhUM/UXXtyFP-25I/AAAAAAAAhx0/8ErLtelY5mA/s1600/ddd.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"240\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ijcp1ImIhUM/UXXtyFP-25I/AAAAAAAAhx0/8ErLtelY5mA/s320/ddd.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When\nthe percussion reaches its crescendo, the parasols are changed with an even\nmore colourful and exquisite one. &nbsp;The\ncrowds between the 30 elephants , a virtual field of consciousness , give a mighty\ncheer for each parasol change . &nbsp;The\ndevotees look on the elephants as the very incarnation of Lord Shiva\u2019s son Lord\nGanesha.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Ya60EOMhOJg/UXXuLJ5hzyI/AAAAAAAAhyE/dlO-WmOGXK0/s1600/eee.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"212\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Ya60EOMhOJg/UXXuLJ5hzyI/AAAAAAAAhyE/dlO-WmOGXK0/s320/eee.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\ngrand finale fireworks happens on the seventh day after the flag hoisting and\nthat marks the end of the festival. &nbsp;&nbsp;You never get the see the majestic blue\ncolours like out here , in world wide fireworks, &nbsp;for expensive copper is involved.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-hbcT_pNIwTY/UXXsWgeK8oI/AAAAAAAAhxY/Cu9gISJuGAU/s1600/ccc.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"270\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-hbcT_pNIwTY/UXXsWgeK8oI/AAAAAAAAhxY/Cu9gISJuGAU/s400/ccc.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\n36-hour celebrations ends with `Vida Chollal' (farewell) ceremony, enacted at\nthe Thekkinkad Maidan. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Divine\nmeeting now completed , the deities of the Thiruvambadi and Paramekkavu temples\nbid farewell to each other and the deity of Sree Vadakkunatha Temple at the\nceremony, with a solemn promise to meet again next year same place, &nbsp;same time..<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-K0UoxxV1mt0/UXXyzCnePhI/AAAAAAAAh0A/JXWDAG-rFXo/s1600/kalari+2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-K0UoxxV1mt0/UXXyzCnePhI/AAAAAAAAh0A/JXWDAG-rFXo/s1600/kalari+2.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 200.95pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This\nis our culture since hoary antiquity -- and we are proud of it. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-AXCkwvQIalY/UXXycZXRhwI/AAAAAAAAhzs/vb_qZzUmeGw/s1600/securedownloadedn.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-AXCkwvQIalY/UXXycZXRhwI/AAAAAAAAhzs/vb_qZzUmeGw/s400/securedownloadedn.jpg\" width=\"480\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is who we are-- &nbsp;from God's own country<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-A1PnutHmx6k/UXXynjwS_dI/AAAAAAAAhz0/TBTeWAVAlC4/s1600/images+(66).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"239\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-A1PnutHmx6k/UXXynjwS_dI/AAAAAAAAhz0/TBTeWAVAlC4/s320/images+(66).jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Harshil Shah<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">September 21, 2014 at\n9:06 AM<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pranam Guruji,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Indeed, i read the\nabove post and its exactly same. Sir, however one question - usually we offer\nwater on shiva lingam (due to reasons explained in one of your earlier post),\nthen at vatican and kabba, are they still continuing the same practice covertly\n?... What happens if this is not continued or are there any other alternatives\n(may be a silly question).. I am still learning...<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">XXXXXXXXXXXXXX<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pranam.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">ON TOP OF THIS DVAITA TEMPLATE --WE HAVE SUPERIMPOSED THE DVAITA TEMPLATE OF THE TRINITY BRAHMA ( CREATOR -RAJAS) - VISHNU ( MEDIATOR-SATTVA ) AND SHIVA ( DESTROYER -TAMAS)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">THIS IS THE DANCE OF OPPOSITE POLES --LIKE EVAPORATION AND CONDENSATION.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">THE WIVES OF TRINITY GODS ARE PART OF THIS DANCE WHICH SUSTAIN THIS COSMOS.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">SARASWATI WIFE OF BRAHMA IS THE MOTHER LIGHT ENERGY FROM QUASARS ( FASTER THAN LIGHT IN SPEED )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/07/gayatri-mantra-savitr-savitur-saraswati.html\" style=\"background-color: lime; color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/07/gayatri-mantra-savitr-savitur-saraswati.html</a><span style=\"background-color: white;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">KALI THE WIFE OF SHIVA IS DARK ENERGY OF THE COSMOS --SHE REPRESENTS THE BLACK HOLE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">In Dvaita Hinduism opposite poles Tamas and Rajas are conscious of each other. Tamas creates Rajas, and Rajas activates/ excites Tamas. Sattva preserves and mediates .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">7000 year old Vedas say that the only constant in the cosmos is change, everything is in a state of flux, nothing is static-- everything is vibratory. This is what guarantees growth and evolution. It is a cosmic spiraling dance of separate opposing forces, which sustains this universe<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">One cannot exist without the other and they are dependant . No phenomenon in this universe is completely devoid of its opposite. They consume each other yet support each other.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">CONTINUED TO 2-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">CONTINUED FROM 1-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">If the restraining balance or equilibrium is lost by the mediator ( Vishnu ) , the universe will spiral out of control and end. This is why Lord Vishnu is called the PRESERVER god. And only Vishnu can have mortal avatars.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">As for the opposing forces TAMAS/ RAJAS ( Brahma/ Shiva ) it really does NOT matter as who is who, like in AC electricity-where you can plug into the socket both ways.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">These two opposing forces are natural and transform each other , in perfect harmony. Harmony can never be stagnant . Lessening of Tamas always results in increase of Rajas and vice versa.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">Balance can never be permanent\u2014 Tamas and Rajas continiously devour each other \u2013 and life flows on. This universe cannot exist without vibrations between two poles.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">THE THIRD TEMPLATE IS SAMKHYA<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">This is about the male and female joint TEAM effort. This is NOT a dance of opposites. In Hinduism we call the MALE- purusha and FEMALE- prakriti.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">In the Tantric cosmology, the whole universe is perceived as being created, penetrated and sustained by two fundamental forces, which are permanently in a perfect, indestructible UNION. These forces or universal aspects are called Shiva ( Purusha ) and Shakti (Prakriti ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">Each of the trinity gods are powerless without their consorts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">Purusha and Pragati is expressed as Shiva and Shakti in the same body 50:50 \u2013 this is NOT a she boy or a transgender . It is a mindboggling, intelligent concept.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">Both Shiva and Shakti are Consciousness---- Shiva is the changeless static aspect of Consciousness, and Shakti is the kinetic, active aspect of the same Consciousness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">Through uniting with Purusha , Pragati gave form to his spirit and created the universe.(we are talking about CREATION OF THE COSMOS here- not street side sex as figured out by small minds)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">When the insentient Prakriti comes in contact with the sentient Purusha , the universe evolves.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">Purusha symbolizes consciousness, the masculine principle. Pragati symbolizes the feminine principle, the activating energy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">The cosmos in all its manifestations, as an act of love. The relationship between say- Shakti and Shiva is the dance of consciousness and energy<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">Prakriti cannot be perceived, not because of its non-existence, but because of its subtlety. It is perceived in its effects.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">The eternal and indestructible union between Shiva and Shakti gives birth to the whole Macrocosm, in its stable, static aspect as well as in its dynamic one. Not only is Shakti responsible for creation, it is also the agent of all change<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">Shakti is manifested by Shiva only during creation and is withdrawn into himself at the end of creation. This is for the perceptive.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">Modern science repeats from our Vedas that matter and energy are interchangeable. So does consciousness and energy .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">Samkhya as you can see was a masterpiece of modeling the ways of the inner universe.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">The union of Shakti with Shiva by Kundalini rise is the liberation of seeker from the cycle of endless birth and death.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">DO YOU THINK IDIOTS LIKE SRI SRI RAVISHANKAR AND SADGURU JAGGI VASUDEV CAN EVER UNDERSTAND THIS\u2014THEIR PADMA VIBHUSHAN&nbsp;&nbsp;MINDS ARE TOO SMALL AND THINKING PROCESS TOO PETTY<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">capt ajit vadakayil<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;
